direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with the lookahead slot and handle iterator exhaustion similarly.
Both methods retrieve the next element from the iterator but differ in exception handling.
Both methods handle exceptions related to iterator state, such as IllegalStateException.
Both methods check the state of the iterator and handle exhaustion conditions.
Both methods interact with the internal state of the iterator, specifically the lookahead slot.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializes the iterator and sets up the PeekingIterator instance.
Checks if there is a next element, which is a prerequisite for calling next().
Can be used to verify the state of the lookahead slot after calling next().
Can be used to verify the next element without advancing the iterator, similar to peek().
